answer_found_by_llm: The network traffic capture file contains 4003 packets in total.
The timestamp of the first packet in the capture file is Apr 10, 2019 16:37:07.129730000 EDT.
The total duration of the network capture is 1 hour, 3 minutes, and 41 seconds (from 16:37:07 EDT to 17:40:48 EDT on April 10, 2019).
The most active computer at the link level has the MAC address 00:08:02:1c:47:ae, which was involved in 1993 packets during the capture period.
There are 2 computers from the organization involved in the capture, identified by their private IP addresses: 10.4.10.132 and 10.4.10.4, both operating within the same /24 network (10.4.10.0/24).
The most active computer at the network level is named "BEIJING-5CD1-PC", which corresponds to the IP address 10.4.10.132.
The organization's DNS server IP address is 10.4.10.4, as evidenced by the DNS response traffic in the capture file.
The domain queried in packet 204 is "proforma-invoices.com".
The domain "proforma-invoices.com" resolves to IP address 217.182.138.150 according to the DNS responses in the pcap file.
The victim's machine is running Windows 7 (64-bit), as identified from the HTTP User-Agent string which shows "Windows NT 6.1" with WOW64 architecture.
Yes, there is a suspicious file downloaded during the network capture. The file is named "tkraw_Protected99.exe" and was downloaded from proforma-invoices.com.
Yes, the webserver software can be identified. The suspicious file was hosted on a LiteSpeed webserver.

Yes, there is clear evidence of data theft. The network capture shows multiple SMTP communications containing "HawkEye Keylogger - Reborn v9 - Passwords Logs" in the email subjects, indicating that password and keystroke data was being exfiltrated from the victim's computer via email to sales.del@macwinlogistics.in at regular intervals.
The email server receiving the stolen information is located in the United States (US). The server is part of GoDaddy's infrastructure based in Tempe, Arizona.
Yes, the email server software can be identified. The server is running Exim version 4.91.
The stolen data is sent to the email address sales.del@macwinlogistics.in
Yes, there is a password used by the suspicious file to send the exfiltrated data. The password is "Sales@23".
The malware variant responsible for exfiltrating the stolen data is HawkEye Keylogger - Reborn v9.
